Pre-Game Insights: Armenia took a hit when Latvia handed them a 2-0 defeat in their latest encounter. The former did win the reverse match though, as they secured a triumph to their name by claiming a 2-1 win.
Armenia enter their upcoming game placed as number 97 in the FIFA world ranking. There is a bit of a gap to opponents Latvia, who enter the game ranked number 137 in the world.
Others: Armenia only average a modest 1.5 goals per game in their last six matches in this tournament, in which they scored nine goals. They also conceded six for an average of one per game. They kept their opponents from scoring two times.

Latvia came through the last three games without a win, but still managed to record two draws in this run. They lost 2-0 against Poland, followed by a 1-1 draw with Cyprus. In their last match, they finished even 1-1 against Liechtenstein. Latvia managed to win just once in their past six internationals. They also drew two and lost three, while scoring eight time and letting in three.
